title: Jewish diaspora
summary: The Jewish diaspora (Hebrew: תְּפוּצָה‎, romanized: təfūṣā) or exile (Hebrew: גָּלוּת gālūṯ; Yiddish: golus)[N 1] is the dispersion of Israelites or Jews out of their ancestral homeland (the Land of Israel) and their subsequent settlement in other parts of the globe.[3][4]
